item.title: CFA Level 1 Equities
item.description: Equities Types of Orders Financing Underwriting Markets Constructing an Index Price-Weighted Index Market-Weighted Index Efficient Market Hypothesis Abnormal rate of return Tests for Market Efficiency Tests for independence Return prediction studies Strong-form Efficiency Market Anamolies (public information - tests for Semi-strong EMH) Reasons Why Markets Should be Efficient EMH Conclusions Role of Portfolio Managers (in a perfectly efficient market) Exchange Traded Funds (ETFs) Issuing ETFs Equities Types of Orders Market Orders - Buy or sell orders that are executed at the current price (guarantees execution, but not price) Limit Orders - Buy or sell orders when the stock price passes a desirable limit (guarantees price or better, but not execution) Limit Buy - purchase a stock if and when it can be bout at-or-below a certain price Limit Sell - sell a stock if and when it rises above a certain price Note: A collection of limit orders is called the limit order book.
